results.title: Max et les Ferrailleurs = Max and the Scrap Merchants
results.creator_credit: Claude Sautet, Raymond Danon and Ralph Baum
results.brief_description:
Max is a cop obsessed with catching criminals ‘in the act’. After a few misfortunes, he turns his attention to small time criminals. Abel, a childhood friend of Max is running a scam with a gang of metal scrappers. Unbeknownst to Abel, Max becomes acquainted with his girlfriend Lily, a prostitute. For Lily, Max becomes Felix, a rich bank manager and a regular client. Slowly, Felix/Max feeds Lily information about his bank in order to incite Abel and his gang to commit a failsafe hit.

Credits: Producers, Ralph Baum, Raymond Danon ; director, Claude Sautet ; writers, Claude Neron, Jean-Loup Dabadie, Claude Sautet ; photography, Rene Mathelin ; music, Philippe Sarde.
Cast: Romy Schneider, Michel Piccoli, Bernard Fresson, Francois Perier, Georges Wilson, Bobby Lapointe, Michel Creton, Dany Jacquet, Betty Beckers, Philippe Leotard.

results.title: Max Ernst: journey into the subconscious
results.brief_description: The inner world of painter, Max Ernst, is the subject of this film. One of the principal founders of Surrealism, Max Ernst explores the nature of materials and the emotional significance of shapes to combine with his collages and nether-world canvasses.
results.description: The inner world of painter, Max Ernst, is the subject of this film. One of the principal founders of Surrealism, Max Ernst explores the nature of materials and the emotional significance of shapes to combine with his collages and nether-world canvasses.

results.title: Max's Story: Waterskiing on the Yarra
results.creator_credit: Max Kirwin, Gordon Chisholm and Craig Bellamy
results.brief_description: A story about Max Kirwin, who introduced waterskiing to the Melbourne Moomba Waterfest in 1956. A digital story created to celebrate 50 years of Melbourne Moomba Water Fest.

results.title: Max's money troubles
results.creator_credit: Chris Adshead, Timothy Read, Australia. Department of the Attorney-General and Film Australia
results.brief_description: A humorous dramatisation about the implications of declaring oneself bankrupt. Max is an ordinary family man, who is in deep financial difficulty. His debts far exceed his ability to pay. We follow Max through the steps he must take to solve his seemingly unsolvable problem. He appears to find an ideal expedient in declaring himself bankrupt, but through counselling Max learns of the likely consequences of this and that it should only ever be a last resort. Written by Donald Crombie.

results.title: Max's Christmas and 3 other Christmas stories
results.brief_description: Max’s Christmas It’s Christmas Eve and Max is too excited to go to sleep, so he sneaks downstairs to await Santa’s arrival … “Morris’s disappearing bag” Morris, the youngest child, is ignored on Christams morning until he discovers an overlooked present - a disappearing bag! These two stories are adapted from books by Rosemary Wells. “The Clown of God” Tomie de Paola’s classic picture book of the juggler who is too poor to give a gift to the Christ child. “The Little drummer boy” Joyful drumming, glowing illustrations and the voices of the St. Paul Choir School bring this well-known Christmas story to life. Illustrations by Ezra Jack Keats. Each of these stories is also available as an individual title.

results.title: Max's Christmas (K)
results.creator_credit: Michael Sporn, Paul R. Gagne, Weston Woods Studios and Michael Sporn Animation
results.brief_description: Ruby can’t get her little brother Max to go to sleep on Christmas Eve, and the fun begins as Max sneaks downstairs hoping to see Santa. Based on the book of the same title by Rosemary Wells. Voices: Jenny Agutter and Rex Robbins.

results.title: Mawson Base: face to face
results.creator_credit: Ian Toohill, Rob McCubbin, Ivan Gaal and Victoria. Education Dept. Materials Production
results.brief_description: Shot mainly around the Mawson area and narrated by Dr Phillip Law, this film looks at Antartica through the eyes of the expedition’s cook and the doctor. Raises issues on the future of Antartica and gives insight into the daily pressures of life in isolation. Suitable for upper secondary level.

results.title: Mauvais Sang = Bad Blood
results.creator_credit: Leos Carax, Philippe Diaz and Alain Dahan
results.brief_description:
Alex’s father, an old ganster, has just died. For old time’s sake, Alex asks two former accomplices of his father to organise one last robbery. The target is a new antidote designed to fight a virus called STBO. STBO is spread by having impersonal sex and is killing adolescents by the score. With ‘Mauvais Sang’ (his second film), Leos Carax finds his way into an esthetic movement of French cinema emerging in the 1980’s as ‘neo-baroque’ (aka ‘cinema du look’). Just like Luc Besson and Jean-Jacques Beineix, Carax favours outrageous lighting effects, a very pronounced acting style and a fetishist usage of objects. Awards: Prix Louis Delluc, 1986.

Credits: Producers, Alain Dahan, Philippe Diaz ; director, Leos Carax ; writer, Leos Carax ; photography, Jean-Yves Escoffier ; music, Charlie Chaplin, Sergei Prokofiev, Benjamin Britten.
Cast: Denis Lavant, Juliette Binoche, Michel Piccoli, Hans Meyer, Julie Delpy, Hugo Pratt, Serge Reggiani, Mireille Perrier, Jerome Zucca.

results.title: Maurice Sendak
results.creator_credit: Morton Schindel and Weston Woods Studios
results.brief_description: A visit to Maurice Sendak in his studio apartment, where he speaks of his favourite composers, expresses his admiration for painters and illustrators of the past, tells how these artists have influenced his own work, and traces the development of the book ‘Where the Wild Things Are’.
